prac4

library(tidyverse)
# Install and load nycflights13 for flight data
if (!requireNamespace("nycflights13", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("nycflights13")
}
library(nycflights13)

Question 1:

#Display the flights dataset in an alternative format to simply printing it

Question 2:

#rewriting code 

library(dplyr)

dist_tbl <- flights %>%
  filter(month == 1) %>%            # keep January flights
  group_by(carrier) %>%             # group by carrier
  summarise(
    mean_distance = mean(distance),
    sd_distance   = sd(distance),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  arrange(mean_distance)            # order by mean distance

dist_tbl
# A tibble: 16 √ó 3
   carrier mean_distance sd_distance
   <chr>           <dbl>       <dbl>
 1 YV               229          0  
 2 9E               476.       334. 
 3 EV               522.       294. 
 4 US               536.       553. 
 5 MQ               566.       223. 
 6 FL               691.       142. 
 7 OO               733         NA

12 UA              1462.       778. 
13 F9              1620          0  
14 AS              2402          0  
15 VX              2495.        98.2
16 HA              4983          0

Question 3: Explain why the standard deviation is NA for one carrier, and why it is 0 for others

flights %>%
  filter(month == 1) %>%
  group_by(carrier) %>%
  summarise(
    n_flights = n(),
    unique_distances = n_distinct(distance),
    sd_distance = sd(distance),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  arrange(n_flights)
# A tibble: 16 √ó 4
   carrier n_flights unique_distances sd_distance
   <chr>       <int>            <int>       <dbl>
 1 OO              1                1        NA  
 2 HA             31                1         0  
 3 YV             46                1         0  
 4 F9             59                1         0  
 5 AS             62                1         0  
 6 VX            316                4        98.2
 7 FL            328                3       142. 
 8 WN            996               12       496. 
 9 9E           1573               34       334. 
10 US           1602                9       553. 
11 MQ           2271               21       223. 
12 AA           2794               23       626. 
13 DL           3690               47       644. 
14 EV           4171               59       294. 
15 B6           4427               50       681. 
16 UA           4637               37       778.

The standard deviation is NA for a carrier with only one observation because the sample standard deviation is undefined for ùëõ=1,and it is 0 for carriers whose flights all have identical distances because there is no variability.

Question 4: Constructing a dataframe

library(tidyr)

dep_delay_tbl <- flights %>%
  group_by(month, carrier) %>% 
  summarise(
    mean_dep_delay = mean(dep_delay, na.rm = TRUE),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  pivot_wider(
    names_from = carrier,
    values_from = mean_dep_delay
  )

dep_delay_tbl

Question 5:

prop_delayed_but_on_time <- flights %>%
  filter(!is.na(dep_delay), !is.na(arr_delay)) %>% 
  summarise(
    proportion = mean(dep_delay > 0 & arr_delay <= 0)
  )

prop_delayed_but_on_time
# A tibble: 1 √ó 1
  proportion
       <dbl>
1      0.108

Question 6:

#Identify routes flown by more than one airline
routes_multi <- flights %>%
  group_by(origin, dest) %>%
  summarise(
    n_airlines = n_distinct(carrier),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  filter(n_airlines > 1)

routes_multi
# A tibble: 128 √ó 3
   origin dest  n_airlines
   <chr>  <chr>      <int>
 1 EWR    ATL            4
 2 EWR    AUS            2
 3 EWR    BDL            2
 4 EWR    BNA            2
 5 EWR    BOS            3
 6 EWR    BWI            2
 7 EWR    CHS            2
 8 EWR    CLE            2
 9 EWR    CLT            3
10 EWR    CVG            2
# ‚Ñπ 118 more rows
#Average arrival delay per airline on these routes
route_airline_delays <- flights %>%
  semi_join(routes_multi, by = c("origin", "dest")) %>%
  group_by(origin, dest, carrier) %>%
  summarise(
    mean_arr_delay = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE),
    .groups = "drop"
  )

route_airline_delays
# A tibble: 343 √ó 4
   origin dest  carrier mean_arr_delay
   <chr>  <chr> <chr>            <dbl>
 1 EWR    ATL   9E               -6.25
 2 EWR    ATL   DL               10.0 
 3 EWR    ATL   EV               19.5 
 4 EWR    ATL   UA               10.5 
 5 EWR    AUS   UA                4.28
 6 EWR    AUS   WN              -11.2 
 7 EWR    BDL   EV                6.78
 8 EWR    BDL   UA               22.6 
 9 EWR    BNA   EV               17.7 
10 EWR    BNA   WN               -2.13
# ‚Ñπ 333 more rows
#Find the airline names
route_airline_delays_named <- route_airline_delays %>%
  left_join(airlines, by = "carrier")

route_airline_delays_named
# A tibble: 343 √ó 5
   origin dest  carrier mean_arr_delay name                    
   <chr>  <chr> <chr>            <dbl> <chr>                   
 1 EWR    ATL   9E               -6.25 Endeavor Air Inc.       
 2 EWR    ATL   DL               10.0  Delta Air Lines Inc.    
 3 EWR    ATL   EV               19.5  ExpressJet Airlines Inc.
 4 EWR    ATL   UA               10.5  United Air Lines Inc.   
 5 EWR    AUS   UA                4.28 United Air Lines Inc.   
 6 EWR    AUS   WN              -11.2  Southwest Airlines Co.  
 7 EWR    BDL   EV                6.78 ExpressJet Airlines Inc.
 8 EWR    BDL   UA               22.6  United Air Lines Inc.   
 9 EWR    BNA   EV               17.7  ExpressJet Airlines Inc.
10 EWR    BNA   WN               -2.13 Southwest Airlines Co.  
# ‚Ñπ 333 more rows
#Identify best and worst airline per route
route_best_worst <- route_airline_delays_named %>%
  group_by(origin, dest) %>%
  summarise(
    best_airline  = name[which.min(mean_arr_delay)],
    best_delay    = min(mean_arr_delay),
    worst_airline = name[which.max(mean_arr_delay)],
    worst_delay   = max(mean_arr_delay),
    diff_delay    = worst_delay - best_delay,
    .groups = "drop"
  )

route_best_worst
# A tibble: 128 √ó 7
   origin dest  best_airline     best_delay worst_airline worst_delay diff_delay
   <chr>  <chr> <chr>                 <dbl> <chr>               <dbl>      <dbl>
 1 EWR    ATL   Endeavor Air In‚Ä¶     -6.25  ExpressJet A‚Ä¶       19.5       25.8 
 2 EWR    AUS   Southwest Airli‚Ä¶    -11.2   United Air L‚Ä¶        4.28      15.5 
 3 EWR    BDL   ExpressJet Airl‚Ä¶      6.78  United Air L‚Ä¶       22.6       15.8 
 4 EWR    BNA   Southwest Airli‚Ä¶     -2.13  ExpressJet A‚Ä¶       17.7       19.8 
 5 EWR    BOS   ExpressJet Airl‚Ä¶     -4.01  JetBlue Airw‚Ä¶        6.87      10.9 
 6 EWR    BWI   Southwest Airli‚Ä¶      5.95  ExpressJet A‚Ä¶       20.1       14.1 
 7 EWR    CHS   United Air Line‚Ä¶    -14     ExpressJet A‚Ä¶       16.2       30.2 
 8 EWR    CLE   ExpressJet Airl‚Ä¶     -3.71  United Air L‚Ä¶        5.97       9.68
 9 EWR    CLT   US Airways Inc.       0.920 ExpressJet A‚Ä¶       20.5       19.6 
10 EWR    CVG   Endeavor Air In‚Ä¶      1.40  ExpressJet A‚Ä¶       21.2       19.8 
# ‚Ñπ 118 more rows
#Route with the greatest difference
largest_difference_route <- route_best_worst %>%
  arrange(desc(diff_delay)) %>%
  slice(1)

largest_difference_route
# A tibble: 1 √ó 7
  origin dest  best_airline      best_delay worst_airline worst_delay diff_delay
  <chr>  <chr> <chr>                  <dbl> <chr>               <dbl>      <dbl>
1 JFK    ATL   Endeavor Air Inc.       1.40 ExpressJet A‚Ä¶         128       127.

Although airlines fly the same route, their average arrival delays differ substantially due to airline-specific operational practices such as scheduling slack, fleet allocation, and congestion management, leading to large differences in mean arrival delay on competitive routes

Question 7:

             0              0              0              2              0

             0              0              0              3              0

#checking mistakes
unique(df$gender)
[1] "male"   "female" "femal" 
unique(df$disease_status)
[1] "diseased" "healthy"  "Healthy"

The dataset contains missing values in the height and glucose columns. There are typographical and formatting inconsistencies in categorical variables, including a misspelling "femal" in the gender column and inconsistent capitalization of "Healthy" versus "healthy" in disease_status.
